hints.label: def-fractal-set
hints.title: The Fractal Set
hints.content:
366: :label: def-fractal-set
367: 
368: The **Fractal Set** is the union of CST and IG:
369: 
370: $$
371: \mathcal{F} := (\mathcal{N}, E_{\text{CST}} \cup E_{\text{IG}}, \omega_{\text{CST}}, \omega_{\text{IG}}),
372: 
373: $$
374: 
375: where:
376: - $\mathcal{N}$: Node set (all spacetime points, $|\mathcal{N}| = N \times (T+1)$)
377:   - **Nodes store scalars**: All frame-invariant quantities
378: - $E_{\text{CST}}$: Directed temporal edges (timestep transitions)
379:   - **Edges store spinors**: Velocity, force, displacement spinors
380: - $E_{\text{IG}}$: **Directed spatial edges** (asymmetric selection coupling at each timestep)
381:   - **Edges store spinors**: Relative position, velocity, viscous coupling spinors
382:   - **Key scalar**: Antisymmetric cloning potential $V_{\text{clone}}(i \to j) = \Phi_j - \Phi_i$
383: - $\omega_{\text{CST}} : E_{\text{CST}} \to \mathbb{R}_{>0}$: CST edge weights (typically $\Delta t$)
384: - $\omega_{\text{IG}} : E_{\text{IG}} \to \mathbb{R}_{>0}$: IG edge weights (selection coupling strength)
385: 
386: **Covariance structure:**
387: - **Scalar node data** is **frame-invariant** (same in all coordinate systems)
388: - **Spinor edge data** is **frame-covariant** (transforms under the spinor representation)
389: - Together, they provide a **complete, coordinate-free description** of the Adaptive Gas dynamics
390: 
391: **Separation of concerns:**
392: - **CST**: Encodes **timelike structure** (how state evolves, who clones whom)
393: - **IG**: Encodes **spacelike structure** (contemporaneous **directed** coupling through selection and viscous forces)
394: 
395: **Antisymmetry and fermionic structure:**
396: - IG edges are **directed** with antisymmetric cloning potential: $V_{\text{clone}}(j \to i) = -V_{\text{clone}}(i \to j)$

372: 
373: $$

377:   - **Nodes store scalars**: All frame-invariant quantities

379:   - **Edges store spinors**: Velocity, force, displacement spinors
380: - $E_{\text{IG}}$: **Directed spatial edges** (asymmetric selection coupling at each timestep)
381:   - **Edges store spinors**: Relative position, velocity, viscous coupling spinors
382:   - **Key scalar**: Antisymmetric cloning potential $V_{\text{clone}}(i \to j) = \Phi_j - \Phi_i$
383: - $\omega_{\text{CST}} : E_{\text{CST}} \to \mathbb{R}_{>0}$: CST edge weights (typically $\Delta t$)
384: - $\omega_{\text{IG}} : E_{\text{IG}} \to \mathbb{R}_{>0}$: IG edge weights (selection coupling strength)
385: 
386: **Covariance structure:**
387: - **Scalar node data** is **frame-invariant** (same in all coordinate systems)
388: - **Spinor edge data** is **frame-covariant** (transforms under the spinor representation)
389: - Together, they provide a **complete, coordinate-free description** of the Adaptive Gas dynamics
390: 
391: **Separation of concerns:**
392: - **CST**: Encodes **timelike structure** (how state evolves, who clones whom)
393: - **IG**: Encodes **spacelike structure** (contemporaneous **directed** coupling through selection and viscous forces)

hints.label: thm-fractal-set-reconstruction
hints.title: Reconstruction Theorem: The Fractal Set as Complete Algorithm Representation
hints.content:
404: :label: thm-fractal-set-reconstruction
405: 
406: The Fractal Set $\mathcal{F} = (\mathcal{N}, E_{\text{CST}} \cup E_{\text{IG}}, \omega_{\text{CST}}, \omega_{\text{IG}})$ with scalar node data and spinor edge data contains **complete information** to reconstruct all dynamics of the Adaptive Viscous Fluid Model.
407: 
408: **Statement:** Given the Fractal Set $\mathcal{F}$ storing data from [../07_adaptative_gas.md](../07_adaptative_gas.md), we can reconstruct:
409: 
410: 1. **Full phase space trajectory**: $(x_i(t), v_i(t))$ for all walkers $i \in \{1, \ldots, N\}$ and timesteps $t \in \{0, \ldots, T\}$
411: 2. **All force fields**: $\mathbf{F}_{\text{stable}}(x,t), \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(x,S,t), \mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}}(x,S,t)$ at each spacetime point
412: 3. **Diffusion tensor field**: $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x,S,t)$ at all points
413: 4. **Fitness landscape**: $\Phi(x)$ sampled at walker positions
414: 5. **Virtual reward field**: $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x)$ at all positions
415: 6. **Localized statistical moments**: $\mu_\rho[f_k, \Phi, x], \sigma_\rho[f_k, \Phi, x], Z_\rho[f_k, \Phi, x]$ at all spacetime points
416: 7. **Viscous coupling structure**: Pairwise interactions via IG edge spinors
417: 8. **Alive walker set**: $A_k(t)$ at each timestep via node status flags
418: 9. **Empirical measure**: $f_k(t) = \frac{1}{k}\sum_{i \in A_k(t)} \delta_{(x_i(t), v_i(t))}$ at all timesteps
419: 
420: **Proof:**
421: 
422: 1. **Phase space reconstruction**:
423:    - Positions: Integrate $\psi_{\Delta x}$ along CST edges from initial conditions
424:    - Velocities: Stored as $\psi_{v,t}$ on CST edges, extract via spinor-to-vector map
425:    - Both yield frame-covariant $(x_i(t), v_i(t))$ in any coordinate system
426: 
427: 2. **Force field reconstruction**: CST edges store complete spinor decomposition:
428:    $$
429:    \psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{total}}} = \psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{stable}}} \oplus \psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}} \oplus \psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}}} \oplus \psi_{\mathbf{F}_{\text{friction}}}
430:    $$
431:    Extract each component: $\mathbf{F}_{\text{stable}} = -\nabla U$, $\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} = \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}$, etc.
432: 
433: 3. **Viscous force reconstruction**: IG edges store pairwise contributions $\psi_{\text{viscous},ij}$:
434:    $$
435:    \mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}}(x_i, S, t) = \sum_{j \in A_k(t), j \neq i} \nu K_\rho(x_i, x_j)(v_j - v_i) = \bigoplus_{j \in A_k(t), j \neq i} \psi_{\text{viscous},ij}
436:    $$
437: 
438: 4. **Diffusion tensor reconstruction**: CST edges store $\psi_{\Sigma_{\text{reg}}}$, extract:
439:    $$
440:    \Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S, t) = (H_i(S) + \epsilon_\Sigma I)^{-1/2}
441:    $$
442:    where Hessian $H_i$ can be computed from fitness gradient spinors $\psi_{\nabla V_{\text{fit}}}$
443: 
444: 5. **Fitness and virtual reward**: Node scalars $\Phi(n_{i,t}), V_{\text{fit}}(n_{i,t})$ provide direct sampling
445: 
446: 6. **Statistical moments**: Node scalars $\mu_\rho(n), \sigma_\rho(n), \sigma'_\rho(n), Z_\rho(n)$ stored at each spacetime point
447: 
448: 7. **Localization weights**: IG edges store $K_\rho(x_i, x_j)$ and $w_{ij}(\rho)$, enabling:
449:    $$
450:    \mu_\rho[f_k, \Phi, x_i] = \sum_{j \in A_k} w_{ij}(\rho) \Phi_j
451:    $$
452: 
453: 8. **Alive walker set**: Node status $s(n_{i,t}) \in \{0,1\}$ determines $A_k(t) = \{i : s(n_{i,t}) = 1\}$
454: 
455: 9. **Empirical measure**: Combine alive set with trajectories:
456:    $$
457:    f_k(t) = \frac{1}{|A_k(t)|} \sum_{i \in A_k(t)} \delta_{(x_i(t), v_i(t))}
458:    $$
459: 
460: 10. **SDE verification**: The reconstructed $(x_i(t), v_i(t))$ satisfy the Adaptive Gas SDE:
461:     $$
462:     \begin{aligned}
463:     dx_i &= v_i \, dt \\
464:     dv_i &= \left[\mathbf{F}_{\text{stable}}(x_i) + \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(x_i,S) + \mathbf{F}_{\text{viscous}}(x_i,S) - \gamma v_i\right] dt + \Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i,S) \circ dW_i
465:     \end{aligned}
466:     $$
467:     up to the stochastic noise realization $dW_i$
